bug.author: johanlantz
bug.summary: Setting epochs to any value other than what is in the model definition prevents training
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
I have a trainable model converted from Keras. Starting training works fine but when I try to adjust the epochs value, the training fails to start. It seems I can only use the epochs value in the model default parameters. If I manually change the epochs value when converting the model, I can use the new value from my app but no other values are working. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
A bootstrapped example can be found here: <denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PuBzRLS5WjsxJii4KACW9AL4HFXjeiNM/view?usp=sharing>https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PuBzRLS5WjsxJii4KACW9AL4HFXjeiNM/view?usp=sharing</denchmark-link>
For me, it is sufficient to change the epochs value from the default value 1 to another value here: configuration.parameters = [MLParameterKey.epochs : 1] in ViewController.swift and the training will not start.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/johanlantz>@johanlantz</denchmark-link> I tried downloading that but, google denied access. Could you mark it as public until I download? One question - what is the error message you see in the catch block? Thanks for reporting the issue :)

Sorry about that, here is the new link: <denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EKZuJMYrkXzR9ey2h7xO2mAj6hSzLJWY/view?usp=sharing>https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EKZuJMYrkXzR9ey2h7xO2mAj6hSzLJWY/view?usp=sharing</denchmark-link>
The error is this one: <denchmark-code>Failed to start update task Error Domain=com.apple.CoreML Code=0 "2 is not a valid value given constraint minValue: 1 maxValue: 10 enumeratedNumbers: {( 1, 10 )} for key epochs" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=2 is not a valid value given constraint minValue: 1 maxValue: 10 enumeratedNumbers: {( 1, 10 )} for key epochs} </denchmark-code>
So using 1 or 10 is ok but using anything in between like 2 does not work. Maybe I am misunderstanding but I would expect to be able to input any value less than the epochs?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/johanlantz>@johanlantz</denchmark-link> the following call adds "1" as an allowed epoch value by default since keras model does not capture epochs in the h5 format. coreml_model = coremltools.converters.keras.convert('empty_model.h5', respect_trainable=True) Later, when you do builder.set_epochs(10), we extended the allowed epoch values to [1, 10]. The value you provide during runtime should be one of those. That said, you could change the allowed values by specifying allowed_set: builder.set_epochs(10, allowed_set=[10, 20, 30, 40]) Let me know if that works for you.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/anilkatti>@anilkatti</denchmark-link>
As always, thanks for the super fast reply. You are correct, with your solution I can use other values as well as long as they are in the allowed set. If I may, I would say that the description in xCode is a bit misleading. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7461655/68373027-46789b80-0142-11ea-9f27-f0ea3e55a197.png></denchmark-link>
It says "Maximum number of iterations training takes" and in this case, it shows 10 but I have used: builder.set_epochs(10, allowed_set=[2, 4, 6, 10, 20]) when converting the model and epochs=20 is working when running training. The important thing is that I now know how to run other epoch values so feel free to close this and thanks again for the help.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/johanlantz>@johanlantz</denchmark-link> I agree the message is misleading. I have filed a bug to fix this. Thanks for your feedback.
